FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd source-mac aging-time command sets an aging time for ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses.
The undo ipv6 nd source-mac aging-time command restores the default aging time for ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses. The ipv6 nd source-mac aging-time command sets an aging time for ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses. The undo ipv6 nd source-mac aging-time command restores the default aging time for ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses. The default aging time of ND attack entries with fixed source MAC addresses is 300 seconds. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an aging time for ND attack entries.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 6000, in seconds.
